purpleculture_pinyin:
kān
publication, periodical; publish
издание, периодическое издание; публиковать
rtega_mnemonic:
栞栞RSpublication, periodical, publish, bookmark, guidebook
  • tools 干干 used to make a publication from wood 木 (print block and paper)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Dry an already dry tree to create a bookmark. The more you dry the tree, the flatter it becomes, making it the perfect way to mark your spot in a book without needing to fold a page or write on it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: To be fair, books are just dry trees in a way, but bookmarks are actually dry, dry trees that have flattened out and turned into chunks.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What are you bookmarking anyway? Look down and see yourself putting one of the tree bookmarks on a page in your notebook that says "She owes me reeds (しおり)." Oh yeah, you had to make this bookmark in the first place because your friend took your reed bookmarks and didn't give them back.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: What does she owe you? Open the page to your bookmark and see she owes reeds!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: use the tree (木) for two drying frames (幵) or a bookmark

栞字的基本解释

栞
kān
古同“刊”：栞正。诗文已栞完。

栞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kān］
［《廣韻》苦寒切，平寒，溪。］
“刊1”的古字。
(1)砍，削除。
(2)修订，修改。
(3)刻，雕刻。
(4)识，记。

栞字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　栞； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页522第21
【唐韻】苦寒切【集韻】【韻會】丘寒切，?音看。【說文】栞本作?，槎識也。【書·禹貢】隨山栞木。【徐鉉曰】木識謂隨所行林中，斫其枝爲道記識也。〈天天〉蓋其斫木低折狀，指事。【史記·夏本紀】九山栞旅作栞，《今文尚書》作刋。　又【集韻】稽延切，音甄。義同。

栞字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
栞字的起名意思

暂无。

[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　栞; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 522 21
[Tang Yun] bitter cold cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Qiu Han cut, look at the sound. [Said the text] This is the work of 栞, Cha Shi also. 【Book·Yugong】Suishan Tossawood. [Xu Xuan said] Mu Zhi said that he walked in the forest, and pruning his branches was also a Taoist knowledge.The cover is low-folded, referring to the matter. Name meaning

kān
вм. 刊
Radicals: 干, 木  (dry, tree)
Meaning Mnemonic
Dry an already dry tree to create a bookmark. The more you dry the tree, the flatter it becomes, making it the perfect way to mark your spot in a book without needing to fold a page or write on it.
To be fair, books are just dry trees in a way, but bookmarks are actually dry, dry trees that have flattened out and turned into chunks.
Reading Mnemonic
What are you bookmarking anyway? Look down and see yourself putting one of the tree bookmarks on a page in your notebook that says "She owes me reeds (しおり)." Oh yeah, you had to make this bookmark in the first place because your friend took your reed bookmarks and didn't give them back.
What does she owe you? Open the page to your bookmark and see she owes reeds!
